title: Parameter - Javascript Eval
description: Pipes the parameter into an eval, i.e. eval(%q);
body:
JavaScript Injection (Eval Function)

The user input is piped directly into the browser's eval() function inside a script block.

Param: ?q=

The code contained in the 'q' parameter will be executed immediately. Check for visual confirmation (e.g., an alert box).
objectives: Inject a command to execute arbitrary JavaScript (e.g., `alert(1)`).
Observe the successful execution of the injected code without needing to break out of a context.
hints: No need for quotes or semicolons; the input is executed as raw JavaScript.
